title: 4 new typeface releases from Fountain
content:
Submitted by [paul d hunt](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/typophile.com/user/7006 "View user profile.") : 24.Nov.2005 10.24am 

November 24, 2005  
Malmö , Sweden

Yes it’s true ? new fonts from Fountain  
It took a while to update the site. But we’ve been busy starting our  
own publishing company – Bruhn Förlag – so that we can be able to release  
our own books and catalogues. Read more about it below.  
Some of you may have seen these new typefaces pre-released through  
Veer, but now’s finally the time to release them on our own site. With this  
release we also give a warm welcome two new designers - Thomas Crolla  
and Ricardo Santos.

Scrixel 8 & 16 - a script pixel family in two different sizes. Besides  
a set of alternates and bolds it also features a massive collection of  
decorative elements and arrows. More than you need for your  
webdesigning jobs. Optimized for use in Macromedia Flash. Designed by Thomas  
Crolla.

[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/scrixel.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/scrixel.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/scrixel.asp")

Lisboa - a typeface tribute to the Portuguese capitol . Lisboa is a  
huge family (63 weights). It features a large complement of ligatures,  
lining and old-style figures, expert characters, arrows, brackets, and  
symbols.This modern humanist sans serif contains a lot of warmth.  
Designed by Ricardo Santos.

[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/lisboa.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/lisboa.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/lisboa.asp")

Gretel - inspired by old antique cross-stitch patterns. An embroidery  
typeface family at it’s best. Gretel also come swith a set of homegrown  
dingbats.. A typeface to match your mullet.  
Designed by Sylvia and Daniel Janssen.

[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/gretel.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/gretel.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/gretel.asp")

Incognito - after the popular Zanzibar we give you yet another script  
font designed by Gábor Kóthay. Inspired by old maps and sea charts it  
offers a variation of charaters beyond your most romatic type dreams.

[http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/incognito.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/incognito.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/incognito.asp")

Bruhn Förlag/Bruhn Publishing - is a little publisher dedicated to  
produce books about type & design, childrens books & graphic novels.

Our first release was Lotta Bruhn’s childrens book  
“Prickigkorvmackatjuven”, secondly the type booklet “URGENT! The Messages” designed by  
Peter Bruhn. Which is not just a type specimen but also acounter-attack on  
the heap of SPAM attacking us each day.

[http://www.fountain.nu/fountaineer/urgentbooklet.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.fountain.nu/fountaineer/urgentbooklet.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/fountaineer/urgentbooklet.asp")

The Bruhn Förlag website is due to be online next week.

[http://www.bruhnforlag.se/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070804104445/http:/www.bruhnforlag.se/ "http://www.bruhnforlag.se/")

Simma lugnt!

Peter Bruhn, principal designer & owner  
[Fountain]
